Comments and Criticism are welcome.

item.title: m6
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

When I said gloss and glow, I meant something to soften up the lines. Adding glow to the beizers. And as for gloss, I didn’t take a very good look at your image. It really doesn’t have any need for any gloss (like reflections/white grads overtop).

Read full topic

item.title: m6
item.dc:creator: @brownsymcard brownsymcard
item.description:
@brownsymcard wrote:

http://img227.imageshack.us/img227/6315/glossyglowyayayyayacopybm5.jpg

The rough edges were because I was on a crap monitor and I wasn’t able to see how photoshop screwed up the edges a little when I did a slight color adjustment.

To haxor, this is entirely original, made on Illustrator CS3 (offtopic: demonoid is back :D). It is 100% vector, so I can resize it to whatever I want it to be.

To thatoneguy… I dont wanna be mean… but what are you talking about when you say add gloss and glow to vector? I have not seen one thing in the world improved by “gloss, and glow”. Adding a bevel/making things look glossy and calling it better is something kids do in my school for the graphic design class 1 I help teach. I was pushing it by simply adding gradients to some of the contours…

Read full topic
